titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jerry Stern Reminiscence 2011
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Donna McCrea

publicationstmt.publisher: Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Donna McCrea 2011

repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: This collection consists of Sterns' reminiscences about his time as ranger for the Lincoln Ranger District in Montana in the 1960s, and memories of the Lincoln Backcountry controvery including his interactions with Cecil Garland.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Gerald "Jerry" Stern was a ranger with the United States Forest Service. He was transferred to the Lincoln Ranger District in Montana on March 1, 1964.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two pages of typed reminiscences, entitled "follow up to History of the Lincoln Backcountry Controversy by D. R. Randall," documenting Jerry Stern's time as ranger for the Lincoln Ranger District in Montana in the mid 1960s. A third page is titled "Other comments and Lincoln Ranger District." Topics addressed in the documents include Stern's interactions with Cecil Garland of the Lincoln Backcountry Protective Association, his impression of the Lincoln-Scapegoat area as a timber resource, his memories of working with young adults on the trail crew and with "pressure" groups.

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and The University of Montana-Missoula.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes. Copyright not transferred to The University of Montana.

prefercite.p: [Name of document or photograph number], Jerry Stern Reminiscence, Archives and Special Collections, Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula.

acqinfo.p: The three page reminiscence was written by Jerry Stern in January of 2011 and mailed by him to the Archives.

relatedmaterial.p: Directly related collections held by the Archives include the Lincoln Back Country Protective Association Records (Mss 195) and the Cecil Garland Papers (Mss 637).

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
